p: Coral reefs are one of the most ecologically valuable ecosystems on earth [ 1] providing a number of ecosystem services [ 2], such as shelter for associated fishes [ 3] and crustaceans [ 4, 5, 6, 7], also serving as substrate for coralline algae [ 8, 9]. Stable water conditions are determinant for the maintenance of living corals on reefs [ 10]. However, effects of climate changes put at least 50% of shallow-water species in critical risk of extinction in the next 20 years [ 11, 12].
